intro: Ruellia multifolia, commonly known as the Mexican bluebell, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a soft, velvety texture. Ruellia multifolia thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shaded areas.
